page.title: 03HARTSHEAD FIELD CENTRE
page.content: Hartshead Field Centre is on land belonging to the Central Electricity Generating Board and its two classroom area are housed in property which is part of the disused power station. The twin cooling towers and the disused power station building dominate the valley and can be seen from all parts of the 'D square'. The proposed demolition of the C.E.G.B.building will radicaly alter the skyline.The centre is used primarily by Tameside school and college students.The centre was set up by the Warden, Alan Wright after the local government reform in 1974. The nature trail, guide and topic work explores the{natural history}of the canal and the nearby mixed scrub,woodland and grassland.
